thread.title: FIFA secrecy over plans to reform scandal-battered body
thread.title_full: FIFA secrecy over plans to reform scandal-battered body

author: wtopstaff
title: FIFA secrecy over plans to reform scandal-battered body
text:
Home » News » Sports » FIFA secrecy over plans… FIFA secrecy over plans to reform scandal-battered body By The Associated Press October 18, 2015 6:07 am 
BERN, Switzerland (AP) — The second meeting of the FIFA panel established to “restore the integrity and reputation” of soccer’s scandal-battered governing body has ended with secrecy imposed on the three days of meetings. 
The reform committee is led by Francois Carrard, the former director general of the International Olympic Committee, who would not disclose what was discussed in the Swiss capital Bern. 
Carrard said in a statement he will provide a “progress report with concrete recommendations” to FIFA’s executive committee meeting on Tuesday. 
FIFA on Sunday declined to release these recommendations from the committee it established in a bid to show it could improve governance amid the worst corruption scandal in FIFA’s 111-year history. 
Carrard says he expects to complete his reform proposals at the Nov. 19-20 meeting, adding: “Our progress is on track.” Topics:
